comments:
Test build: I20050212-0918 (on relengbuildserv)

I am unable to run a headless antRunner to run the JUnit and performance tests 
in a test build.

Steps to reproduce:

1.  install eclipse from test build
2.  execute java -jar startup.jar -application org.eclipse.ant.core.antRunner

A .log file is written in the configuration directory with the following 
content:

!SESSION 2005-02-12 11:04:03.661 ----------------------------------------------
-
eclipse.buildId=I20050212-0918
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -application org.eclipse.ant.core.antRunner -
f ../test.xml
Command-line arguments:  -application org.eclipse.ant.core.antRunner -
f ../test.xml

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-02-12 11:04:03.662
!MESSAGE Bundle org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start not found.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-02-12 11:04:03.664
!MESSAGE Bundle org.eclipse.update.configurator@3:start not found.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-02-12 11:04:03.678
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:323)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:149)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:261)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:817)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:801)
"1108224243285.log" 27L, 1393C                                1,1           All
Sorry for this false alarm.  This looks like a case of bad build timing on my part.
